column4: guys help me with this this is troubling me for a week i try to install oracle 11g in ubuntu from this tutorial http://www.pythian.com/blogs/968/installing-oracle-11g-on-ubuntu-804-lts-hardy-heron the problem is i am not able to set the display variable i have tried every thing all i get this is this someone please help http://paste.ubuntu.com/57921/
erm, you are not expected to exit after setting the display variable
and if you are doing a graphical login with the oracle user, you do not need to set the display var
okiee will try that and let you know in a minute sir but graphical login you mean gksudo ???
since you are logging int with root (which is BAD), it will probably be easier to ssh -X oracle@localhost, that will take care of setting up the display var
no, i mean, like, when logging into the system, using the oracle user
and there was a repository for Oracle XE, much easier to install
well what to do now sir ?
sir trying to enter through the login screen it says the admin has disabled your account
I am sorry, but you really need an introduction to linux/unix before installing Oracle on a *nix system
willing to learn sir :) i may be foolish though but whats the wrong i am doing sir
don't have enough time for a step-by-step tutoring right now, sorry :\
sir well could you just say what did i do wrong not a step by step tutorial rather a line of wisdom :d
you are doing too many mistakes because you just doing copy/paste from a tutorial without understanding, nothing I can fix with a single line, sorry
